channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge series of potholes when turning left from Greenhills Road onto Moorend Road, 11th December
item.description:
This corner is poorly maintained, it does not feel safe to be driving over, potholes must be filled in
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocked drain on Battledown Approach, 11th December
item.description:
The drain near the top of Holy Apostles School grounds, and on the same side as the school, opposite the house named ‘Hillview’ is blocked. I have tried to unblock it, but to no avail.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battledown Approach, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Continuous flow of water out of road due to broken storm drain, 11th December
item.description:
You closed my last ticket claiming the issue is sorted. It is not! The road is still flooded, we cannot access our drive without driving/walking over the flooded road. There is lots of silt coming out of the ground and a small fountain of water coming out of the road constantly. You have now jetted the drains TWICE despite this not alleviating the problem, why come again and do the same thing when it didn’t work the first time? What a waste of resources. Please treat this issue with the severity it deserves and carry out a cctv survey which I’m sure will show that the storm drain under the road is actually damaged and needs repairing as per what your colleague confirmed to me when he tried to jet the drains and failed….the first time. We are seeking legal advice.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, School Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
